CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 7, reads: "Negro Insurance Promotion - Shown are members and officers of the Greater Pittsburgh Insurance Managers Association, formed a couple of years ago to promote Negro insurance in Pittsburgh area. Left to right, seated: Lawrence F. Page, the association's chaplain, of Provident Insurance Co.; Lee A. Matthews, treasurer, American Woodmen; Miss Maude Hawkins, vice president, North Carolina Mutual; Edward A. Palm, president, Provident; Mrs. Isabelle Robinson, corresponding secretary, American Woodmen; Richard C. Skowes, secretary, Supreme Life, and William C. Forney, parliamentarian, North Carolina Mutual.  Standing: James P. Black, American Woodmen; J. F. Ellis and Mrs. M. Edna Bonner of Provident; Harry Carter, North Carolina, and J. D. Lewis, retired manager of North Carolina."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men from Greater Pittsburgh Insurance Managers Association, seated left to right: Lawrence F. Page, Lee A. Matthews, Maude Hawkins, Edward A. Palm, Isabelle Robinson, Richard C. Skowes, William C. Forney; standing: James P. Black, J. F. Ellis, M. Edna Bonner, Harry Carter, and J. D. Lewis, gathered around table in Loendi Club
